00059     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00060     /// @class Vector3
00061     /// @headerfile vector3.h
00062     /// @brief This is used to represent a point in space, or a vector through space
00063     /// @details This contains an X, Y and a Z value used to represent coordinates.
00064     /// This also has a number of facilities to make converting from Physics subsystem
00065     /// vectors or graphics subsystems as easy as possible
00066     class PHYS_LIB Vector3
00067     {
00068     public:
00069 
00070         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00071         // The Essentials
00072 
00073         /// @brief Coordinate on the X vector.
00074         Real X;
00075         /// @brief Coordinate on the Y vector.
00076         Real Y;
00077         /// @brief Coordinate on the Z vector.
00078         Real Z;
00079 
00080         /// @brief Default Constructor.
00081         /// @details Basic all zero initialization constructor.
00082         Vector3();
00083 
00084         /// @brief Real value Constructor.
00085         /// @details Constructor that sets all three vectors.
00086         /// @param X Coordinate on the X vector.
00087         /// @param Y Coordinate on the Y vector.
00088         /// @param Z Coordinate on the Z vector.
00089         Vector3(Real X, Real Y, Real Z);
00090 
00091         /// @brief Ogre Value Constructor.
00092         /// @details Constructor that sets all values to match the Ogre vector.
00093         /// @param Vec The vector to be copied to make this vector.
00094         Vector3(Ogre::Vector3 Vec);
00095 
00096         /// @brief Bullet Value Constructor.
00097         /// @details Constructor that sets all values to match the Bullet vector.
00098         /// @param Vec The vector to be copied to make this vector.
00099         Vector3(btVector3 Vec);
00100 
00101         /// @brief cAudio Value Constructor.
00102         /// @details Constructor that sets all values to match the cAudio vector.
00103         /// @param Vec The vector to be copied to make this vector.
00104         Vector3(cAudio::cVector3 Vec);
00105 
00106         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00107         // Assignment Operators
00108 
00109         /// @brief Assignment operator to convert from Bullet Vectors
00110         /// @details This copies the x,y and z values from the bullet into this vector
00111         /// @param bt3 This is a btVector3 that will be copied
00112         Vector3& operator= (const btVector3 &bt3);
00113 
00114         /// @brief Assignment operator to convert from Ogre Vectors
00115         /// @details This copies the x,y and z values from the bullet into this vector
00116         /// @param OVec3 This is a Ogre::Vector3 that will be copied.
00117         Vector3& operator= (const Ogre::Vector3 &OVec3);
00118 
00119         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00120         // Equality Comparison operators
00121 
00122         /// @brief Equality Comparison Operator
00123         /// @details Returns true if X==X, Y==Y and Z==Z. If any of those do not match this returns false.
00124         /// @param Vec2 This is the other phys::Vector3.
00125         bool operator== (const phys::Vector3 &Vec2);
00126 
00127         /// @brief Equality Comparison Operator
00128         /// @details Returns true if X==getX(), Y==getY() and Z==getZ(). If any of those do not match this returns false.
00129         /// @param Vec2 This is an btVector3 that needs to be compared with this.
00130         bool operator== (const btVector3 &Vec2);
00131 
00132         /// @brief Equality Comparison Operator
00133         /// @details Returns true if X==x, Y==y and Z==z. If any of those do not match this returns false.
00134         /// @param Vec2 This is an Ogre::Vector3 that needs to be compared with this.
00135         bool operator== (const Ogre::Vector3 &Vec2);
00136 
00137         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00138         // Unary Operators
00139         /// @brief Additive Inverse Operator
00140         /// @details Returns the opposite Vector3 relative to 0,0,0
00141         Vector3 operator- ();
00142 
00143         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00144         // Vector3 Arithmetic with Real
00145         /// @brief Scaling by multiplication
00146         /// @details This Multiplies X, Y and Z by scalar
00147         /// @return This returns a Vector3 that has been scaled
00148         /// @param scalar This is the amount to scale the Vector3 by
00149         Vector3 operator* (const Real &scalar) const;
00150 
00151         /// @brief Scaling by Division
00152         /// @details This Diisionn X, Y and Z by scalar
00153         /// @return This returns a Vector3 that has been scaled
00154         /// @param scalar This is the amount to scale the Vector3 by
00155         Vector3 operator/ (const Real &scalar) const;
00156 
00157         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00158         // Vector3 Arithmetic and assignment with Real
00159         /// @brief Scaling by multiplication.
00160         /// @details This Multiplies X, Y and Z by scalar and stores the changes in this Vector3.
00161         /// @param scalar This is the amount to scale the Vector3 by.
00162         void operator*= (const Real &scalar);
00163 
00164         /// @brief Scaling by Division
00165         /// @details This Division X, Y and Z by scalar and and stores the changes in this Vector3.
00166         /// @param scalar This is the amount to scale the Vector3 by
00167         void operator/= (const Real &scalar);

00177         /// @details Allows for subtraction from a phys::Vector3
00178         /// @param Vec2 This is the other phys::Vector3
00179         Vector3 operator- (const Vector3 &Vec2) const;

00223         Vector3 operator- (const Ogre::Vector3 &Vec2);

00225         /// @brief Bullet Multiplication Operator
00226         /// @details Allows for multiplying  between a phys::Vector3 and a Ogre::Vector3
00227         /// @param Vec2 This is the Ogre::Vector3 to be multiplied
00228         Vector3 operator* (const Ogre::Vector3 &Vec2);

00230         /// @brief Bullet Division Operator
00231         /// @details Allows for division  between a phys::Vector3 and a Ogre::Vector3
00232         /// @param Vec2 This is the Ogre::Vector3 to be divided
00233         Vector3 operator/ (const Ogre::Vector3 &Vec2);

00235         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00236         // Fancy Math
00237 
00238         /// @brief This is used to calculate the crossproduct of this and another vector
00239         /// @details This creates a third vector, which should be on a line perpendicular
00240         /// to lines that contain the origin and the other vectors \n\n
00241         /// Thanks to the guys at Ogre3d for the well written version of this function
00242         /// that we based this on.
00243         /// @param rkVector the Vector to work with to create the cross product
00244         /// @return This is the crossproduct of this vector and rkVector
00245         Vector3 CrossProduct( const Vector3& rkVector ) const;
00246 
00247         /// @brief This is used to calculate the dotproduct of this and another vector
00248         /// @details This calculates the sum of the products of X, Y and Z. \n\n
00249         /// Thanks to the guys at Ogre3d for the well written version of this function
00250         /// that we based this on.
00251         /// @param vec The vector to work with to create the cross product
00252         /// @return This is the dotproduct of this vector and vec
00253         Real dotProduct(const Vector3& vec) const;
00254 
00255         /// @brief This will change this point into it's own normal relative to the origin
00256         /// @details This will change this vector into one that is the same direction from the origin, but only one unit a away.
00257         void Normalize();
00258 
00259         /// @brief This returns the normal for this relative to the origin
00260         /// @details This will return a vector that is 1 unit in away from the origin, if a line were starting and the origin it would pass through
00261         /// both the normal and the original point.
00262         /// @return At a vector3 that is the normal of this Vector3 or 0,0,0 if the current Vector is all 0s
00263         Vector3 GetNormal() const;
00264 
00265         /// @brief This will inverse the reals in the vector.
00266         /// @details This function will inverse all the reals in the vector.
00267         void Inverse();
00268 
00269         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00270         // Manual Conversions
00271         /// @brief Gets a Bullet vector3.
00272         /// @details Creates a Bullet vector3 with values equal to this class and returns it.
00273         btVector3 GetBulletVector3() const;
00274 
00275         /// @brief Copies an existing Bullet vector3.
00276         /// @details This function will copy the values stored in an existing Bullet vector3
00277         /// and set the values of this class to be the same.
00278         /// @param temp The vector3 to be extracted.
00279         void ExtractBulletVector3(btVector3 temp);
00280 
00281         /// @brief Gets a Ogre vector3.
00282         /// @details Creates a Ogre vector3 with values equal to this class and returns it.
00283         Ogre::Vector3 GetOgreVector3() const;
00284 
00285         /// @brief Copies an existing Ogre vector3.
00286         /// @details This function will copy the values stored in an existing Ogre vector3
00287         /// and set the values of this class to be the same.
00288         /// @param temp The vector3 to be extracted.
00289         void ExtractOgreVector3(Ogre::Vector3 temp);
00290 
00291         /// @brief Gets a cAudio vector3.
00292         /// @details Creates a cAudio vector3 with values equal to this class and returns it.
00293         cAudio::cVector3 GetcAudioVector3() const;
00294 
00295         /// @brief Copies an existing cAudio vector3.
00296         /// @details This function will copy the values stored in an existing cAudio vector3
00297         /// and set the values of this class to be the same.
00298         /// @param temp The vector3 to be extracted.
00299         void ExtractcAudioVector3(cAudio::cVector3 temp);
00300 
00301         /// @brief This return the distance between this point and another
00302         /// @details This uses a 3d extension of pythagoras thereom to calculate the distance between
00303         /// This Vector3 and another.
00304         /// @param Vec2 this is the other point to measure against
00305         /// @return This returns a Real number which is the distance.
00306         Real Distance(const Vector3 &Vec2) const;
